overview:
Danny Tuten started his technology career as CTO of RamWorks, one of the very first web architecture shops, in 1995. There he became one of the world’s first 100% Java certified developers, and wrote the core code for AdmiNet, one of the first content management systems for the web. He was an integral part of the management team that successfully sold RamWorks to Modis (NYSE:MPSE) in 1999.

Tuten then went on to found Version2Networks, a software development consultancy.

In 2012, Tuten joined SixIntel as Director of Engineering, where he leads and grows the engineering, database, QA and IT teams.

In his spare time Tuten enjoys racing Corvettes and walking on the beach near his home.
